intro: Collomia grandiflora var. tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. This variety is distinguished by its smaller, more slender flowers compared to the typical form of Collomia grandiflora.
